oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christ Temple Apostolic Church North, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Christ Temple Apostolic Church North located at 1600 Tenth Avenue North in Nashville Tennessee. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are red brick. The roof is gabled and hipped with a non-uniform placement of tar shingles. The windows are red, frosted glass. The doors are metal with glass window. Also of note is an external, separate metal bell tower with working bell situated next to the church. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Christ Temple Apostolic Church North (Nashville, Tenn.)
